nodes.name: URLTextFileReader
nodes.description: Reads text file from the given URL and creates a DataFrame from it. Each line in the file is a record in the DataFrame.

fields.name: storageLevel
fields.title: Output Storage Level
fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

fields.name: url
fields.title: URL
fields.description: URL of the file

nodes.name: PrintNRows
nodes.description: Prints the specified number of records in the DataFrame. It is useful for seeing intermediate output
nodes.details:
This node is used to print incoming dataset.

Number of rows that needs to be printed can be configured in the node.

fields.name: storageLevel
fields.title: Output Storage Level
fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

fields.name: n
fields.title: Num Rows to Print
fields.description: number of rows to be printed

fields.name: displayDataType
fields.title: Display Data Type
fields.description: If true display rows DataType

nodes.name: FieldSplitter
nodes.description: This node splits the string of the specified input column using the specified delimiter
nodes.details:
Splits the string of the specified input column using the specified delimiter. The new column names are specified by the user.

The new dataframe would have the new columns added to it.
nodes.examples:
If a String Column stores values in [PRD_CD]:[PRD_NAME] format and incoming Dataframe has a value as CD01:DrillMachine
then using : as Separator to split data into two Columns (Col1, Col2) would result in followings:

  • Col1 : CD01
  • Col2 : DrillMachine

fields.description: Separator to split the input column value (default: space)

fields.name: comment
fields.value:
This Worflow does the following:

  • Reads text file from the URL and creates a DataFrame from it. Each line in the file is a record in the DataFrame.
  • Splits the string of the input column using the delimiter
  • Creates a new DataFrame containing rows satisfying the provided condition
fields.title: Comment
fields.description: Comments for the Workflow
